Reference#

Environment#

class navground_learning.env.GymAgentConfig(flat: bool = False, history: int = 1, include_target_distance: bool = True, max_target_distance: float = inf, include_target_direction: bool = True, include_velocity: bool = False, include_angular_speed: bool = False, max_speed: float = inf, max_angular_speed: float = inf, include_radius: bool = False, max_radius: float = inf, max_acceleration: float = inf, max_angular_acceleration: float = inf, use_acceleration_action: bool = False, use_wheels: bool = False, fix_orientation: bool = False)#

Configuration of observations produced and actions consumed by a navground.sim.Agent in a navground_learning.env.NavgroundEnv.

Parameters:

  • flat (bool) – Whether to use a flat observation space

  • history (int) – The size of the queue to use for observations. If larger than 1, recent observations will be stacked, and then flattened.

  • include_target_distance (bool) – Whether to include the target distance in the observations.

  • max_target_distance (float) – The upper bound of target distance. Only relevant if include_target_distance=True

  • include_target_direction (bool) – Whether to include the target direction in the observations.

  • include_velocity (bool) – Whether to include the current velocity in the observations.

  • include_angular_speed (bool) – Whether to include the current angular_speed in the observations.

  • max_speed (float) – The upper bound of the speed.

  • max_angular_speed (float) – The upper bound of the angular speed.

  • include_radius (bool) – Whether to include the own radius in the observations.

  • max_radius (float) – The upper bound of own radius. Only relevant if include_radius=True.

  • max_acceleration (float) – The upper bound of the acceleration.

  • max_angular_acceleration (float) – The upper bound of the angular acceleration.

  • use_acceleration_action (bool) – Whether actions are accelerations. If not set, actions are velocities.

  • use_wheels (bool) – Whether action and observation uses wheel speeds/acceleration. If not set, action and observation uses body speeds/acceleration. Only effective if the agent uses a wheeled kinematics.

  • fix_orientation (bool) – Whether to force the agent not to control orientation, i.e., to not include the angular command in actions.

property action_space: Space#

The configured action space

Returns:

The action space

configure(scenario: Scenario | None = None, behavior: Behavior | None = None, state: SensingState | None = None, sensor: Sensor | None = None, index: int = 0) → GymAgentConfig#

Configure for use by a specific navigation behavior and/or sensor.

If a sensor or a state are provided, it updates the sensing space. If a behavior is provided, it inherits parameters like max_speed. If a scenario, it first sample a behavior (and possibly a sensor) associated with the agent at the given index, and then perform similar updates.

Parameters:

  • scenario (Scenario | None) – The scenario

  • behavior (Behavior | None) – The behavior

  • state (SensingState | None) – The state

  • sensor (Sensor | None) – The sensor

  • index (int) – The agent index in the scenario

Returns:

The configuration specific to the provided navground objects.

Return type:

GymAgentConfig

property observation_space: Space#

The configured observation space

Returns:

The observation space

class navground_learning.env.NavgroundEnv(scenario: Scenario | str | Dict[str, Any] | None = None, agent_index: int = 0, sensor: Sensor | str | Dict[str, Any] | None = None, config: GymAgentConfig | None = None, reward: Callable[[Agent, World, float], float] | None = None, time_step: float = 0.1, max_duration: float = -1.0, bounds: Tuple[ndarray, ndarray] | None = None, truncate_outside_bounds: bool = True, render_mode: str | None = None, render_kwargs: Mapping[str, Any] = {}, realtime_factor: float = 1.0)#

Bases: Env

This class describes an environment that uses a navground.sim.Scenario to generate and then simulate a navground.sim.World.

Actions and observations relates to a selected individual navground.sim.Agent.

The behavior is registered under the id "navground":

>>> import gymnasium as gym
>>> import navground_learning.env
>>> from navground import sim
>>>
>>> scenario = sim.load_scenario(...)
>>> env = gym.make("navground", scenario=scenario)
Parameters:

  • scenario (Scenario | str | Dict[str, Any] | None) – The scenario to initialize all simulated worlds. If a str, it will be interpreted as the YAML representation of a scenario. If a dict, it will be dumped to YAML and then treated as a str.

  • agent_index (int) – The world index of the selected agent, must be smaller than the number of agents.

  • sensor (Sensor | str | Dict[str, Any] | None) – A sensor to produce observations for the selected agent. If None, it will use the selected agent own state estimation, if a sensor.

  • config (GymAgentConfig | None) – The configuration of the action and observation space to use. If None, it will default to GymAgentConfig.

  • reward (Callable[[Agent, World, float], float] | None) – The reward function to use. If None, it will default to social_reward().

  • time_step (float) – The simulation time step applied at every step().

  • max_duration (float) – If positive, it will signal a truncation after this simulated time.

  • bounds (Tuple[ndarray, ndarray] | None) – The area to render and a fence for truncating processes when agents exit it.

  • render_mode (str | None) – The render mode. If “human”, it renders a simulation in real time via websockets (see navground.sim.ui.WebUI). If “rgb_array”, it uses navground.sim.ui.render.image_for_world() to render the world on demand.

  • render_kwargs (Mapping[str, Any]) – Arguments passed to navground.sim.ui.render.image_for_world()

  • realtime_factor (float) – a realtime factor for render_mode=”human”: larger values speed up the simulation.

  • truncate_outside_bounds (bool) –

get_behavior_and_sensor() → Tuple[Behavior | None, Sensor | None] | None#

Sample a navigation behavior from the scenario and possibly a sensor, if not configured to use a specific sensor

Returns:

The agent navigation behavior and the sensor used by the MDP

Return type:

Tuple[Behavior | None, Sensor | None] | None

Returns:

The initialization arguments.

Return type:

Reward functions#

navground_learning.env.null_reward(agent: Agent, world: World, time_step: float) → float#

A dummy zero reward.

Parameters:

  • agent (Agent) – The agent

  • world (World) – The world

  • time_step (float) – The time step

Returns:

zero

Return type:

float

navground_learning.env.social_reward(alpha: float = 0.0, beta: float = 1.0, critical_safety_margin: float = 0.0, safety_margin: float | None = None, default_social_margin: float = 0.0, social_margins: Mapping[int, float] = {}) → Callable[[Agent, World, float], float]#

Reward function for social navigation, see (TODO add citation)

Parameters:

  • alpha (float) – The weight of social margin violations

  • beta (float) – The weight of efficacy

  • critical_safety_margin (float) – Violation of this margin has maximal penalty of -1

  • safety_margin (float | None) – Violations between this and the critical safety_margin have a linear penalty. If not set, it defaults to the agent’s own safety_margin.

  • beta – The weight of efficacy

  • default_social_margin (float) – The default social margin

  • social_margins (Mapping[int, float]) – The social margins assigned to neighbors’ ids

Returns:

A function that returns -1 if the safety margin is violated or weighted sum of social margin violations and efficacy.

Return type:

Callable[[Agent, World, float], float]

Inference#

class navground_learning.behaviors.PolicyBehavior(kinematics: Kinematics | None = None, radius: float = 0.0, policy: Any | None = None, config: GymAgentConfig | None = None)#

Bases: Behavior

A navigation behavior that evaluates a ML policy

  • max_angular_acceleration (float)

State: SensingState

Parameters:

  • kinematics (Kinematics | None) – The agent kinematics

  • radius (float) – The agent radius

  • policy (Any) – The policy

  • config (GymAgentConfig | None) – How to use the policy (default if not specified)

Models#

class navground_learning.policies.OrderInvariantCombinedExtractor(observation_space: ~gymnasium.spaces.dict.Dict, cnn_output_dim: int = 256, normalized_image: bool = False, order_invariant_keys: ~typing.Collection[str] = [], filter_key='', net_arch: ~typing.Sequence[int] = [8], activation_fn=<class 'torch.nn.modules.activation.ReLU'>, reductions: ~typing.Sequence[~typing.Callable[[~torch.Tensor, int, bool], ~torch.Tensor]] = [<built-in method sum of type object>])#

Bases: BaseFeaturesExtractor

A variation of SB3 CombinedExtractor that applies a ordering invariant MLP feature extractor to a group of keys after optionally masking it.

Same as the original CombinedExtractor: Combined features extractor for Dict observation spaces. Builds a features extractor for each key of the space. Input from each space is fed through a separate submodule (CNN or MLP, depending on input shape), the output features are concatenated and fed through additional MLP network (“combined”).

Parameters:

  • observation_space (Dict) –

  • cnn_output_dim (int) – Number of features to output from each CNN submodule(s). Defaults to 256 to avoid exploding network sizes.

  • normalized_image (bool) – Whether to assume that the image is already normalized or not (this disables dtype and bounds checks): when True, it only checks that the space is a Box and has 3 dimensions. Otherwise, it checks that it has expected dtype (uint8) and bounds (values in [0, 255]).

  • order_invariant_keys (Collection[str]) – the keys to group together and process by an ordering invariant feature extractor

  • filter_key – the key to use for masking to select items with positive values of this key

  • net_arch (Sequence[int]) – the ordering invariant MLP layers sizes

  • activation_fn – the ordering invariant MLP activation function

  • reductions (Sequence[Callable[[Tensor, int, bool], Tensor]]) –

Training#

Behavior cloning#

class navground_learning.il.bc.Trainer(env: Env | None = None, parallel: bool = False, n_envs: int = 1, seed: int = 0, verbose: bool = False, runs: int = 0, bc_kwargs: dict[str, Any] = {}, **kwargs: Any)#

A simplified interface to imitation.algorithms.bc.BC

Parameters:

  • env (Env | None) – the [navground] enviroment.

  • parallel (bool) – whether to parallize the env

  • n_envs (int) – the number of vectorized envs

  • seed (int) – the random seed

  • verbose (bool) – whether to print training logs

  • runs (int) – how many runs to collect at init

  • kwargs (Any) – Param passed to the [vectorized] env constructor

  • bc_kwargs (dict[str, Any]) –
